alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:50PM CDT until May 19 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Dent, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Gladden Creek at Highway KK, Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Little Piney River at Union Road, Boone Creek at Boone Creek Road, Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Spring Valley at Highway N and Big Creek at County Road 390. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Houston, Licking, Eminence, Summersville, Bunker, Raymondville, Huggins, Montauk, Hartshorn, Eunice, Akers, Yukon, Jadwin, Darien, Prescott, Solo, Gladden, Round Spring, Bucyrus, Simmons, Elk Creek, Turtle, Hazelton, Success, Roby, Midridge, Bendavis, Montauk State Park, Current River State Park, Echo Bluff State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
